page.title: 17GOURDIE INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: The National Cash Register consists of two factories. These are known as Gourdie factory and Birkhill factory, which of course takes its name from the nearby village. The main line production is now the Keycard slot Banking Terminals which are used by all the major banks. The other major factory in this area is "Merrymate" a producer of soft drinks and lemonades. Together these two employers account for nearly half the workforce in the area. Other buildings include photographic developers,offices and clerical businesses.This area is developing rapidly and is now one of the major industrial estates in the Dundee District.
